title: Electric PE - charges in a square and Sphere A

content.question:
Show all your work for each part of the the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

Four small charged spheres are fixed in place at the vertices of a square of side length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The charged spheres at the upper-left and lower-left corners of the square each have a positive charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></math> while the two charged spheres at the upper-right and lower-right corners of the square each have a negative charge <math alttext="negative 2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>. Also shown are five dots, with one located at the center of the square, three located at the midpoints of three sides of the square, and one located a distance <math alttext="5 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mi>s</mi></math> to the right of the square.

(a) At each of the five dots in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, indicate the direction of the electric field, if any, at the dot’s location. If the field is zero at any of the dots, write “<math alttext="E equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>” next to those dots. Otherwise, represent each field direction with an arrow that starts on a dot and points in the direction of the field.
Note: It is not necessary to indicate the relative magnitudes of the electric fields at the different locations.

a distance of <math alttext="5 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mi>s</mi></math> to the right of the square
